abstract: China has more than $3 trillion in foreign currency reserves, far more than any other nation, and for two years Europe has been begging Beijing to use some of that money to buy troubled European debt. Has China's economic might already reordered the global pecking order? Are European concessions, both economic and political, inevitable?

headline.main: What Will China Demand in Exchange for Helping Europe?
